results.content: Would like to hear about real world scenarios and how the architecture/design patterns(mediator) helps rather just how-to. I have intermediate experiences in implementing Onion Architecture and therefore, able to understand from external resources about how MediatR and CQRS is able to help in long run. However, MediatR may not be efficient at times(you explained it in the beginning), but missed out the explanation on simple Service class that can actually replace MediatR in a small scale project, which is still effective in terms of productivity and maintenance while also maintaining onion architecture. Of course, there is no right or wrong by implementing it, but, it wouldn't be necessary sometimes.

response.content: I appreciate this feedback. I have other courses showing the simpler implementation options, which is why I created this one for specifically CQRS and Mediatr demonstration.
response.content_html: I appreciate this feedback. I have other courses showing the simpler implementation options, which is why I created this one for specifically CQRS and Mediatr demonstration.
